Summary: The staff was great. They upgraded us to a room with a king sized bed. Unfortunately the room faced the parking lot and we were woken up twice at 11:30pm on Saturday night and 7:30am on Sunday morning because people opened and closed their car doors and talked and talked and talked. But the bed was comfortable so that was a consolation prize. Other than that, the location wasn’t too far from the beach and we were really close to San Clemente Cafe which serves great breakfasts.

Summary Heading: Crooks, liars, thieves, Wyndham doesn't care either
Summary: My room was canceled because they try to charge more than the rate you purchased online.  Glad I didn't get ripped-off but had to sleep in my truck after coming from the ER with broken ribs.  Sketch folks, sketchy hotel, directly on the highway ....my truck was better.  Get a camp site, you'll thank me later   Evil eyes she has.

Summary Heading: Motel quality for more than $500 two night stay
Summary: This hotel is pretty much motel quality. For a Fri/Sat 2 night stay it was way over priced, totaling over $500.  No pool/spa and cramped parking sites. Trucks will have a major parking issue if towing.  There are better choices to stay in Dana Point.

Summary Heading: Motel quality for what you pay for. Way over priced.
Summary: This is motel quality.  Very minimal, basic amenities.  The room was clean, and standard comfortability. More pillows needed.  No morning breakfast. No outdoor pool/spa. 3rd floor has spa if you request.    Our view was of roof on 3rd floor - ask for another floor.Parking is extremely compact.  Will not stay here again.

I absolutely love this hotel and the management team at this location. The hotel is clean. The staff is friendly and hospitable and take great pride in providing a safe and healthy, family friendly environment! I would and have recommended this hotel to several friends and family members! Thank you Nick & Jenny! I will see you again soon!!

This hotel should not have the name of ( by Wyndham) because people think and expect they are to a nice hotel but it is not. I don’t know how Wyndham qualify their hotel because this will them a bad reputation.

Summary Heading: Nice size room and view of the Pacific Ocean!
Summary: Decent facility, nice size room and with a good view of the Pacific Ocean… if you don’t mind a little road noise. Staff is friendly, room and facility was clean. Nice to have parking as well! Would stay there again!

Overall the stay was fine but for the price, the value was just not there. I called and asked for an early check-in, which the gentleman agreed to set up and upon my early arrival, no room was ready and I had to pay for an upgraded room (“ocean view” with no patio and actually looking at a roof top) in order to access the space early as promised. The cost was high for the location (literally on the highway so loud traffic all night) and next to a major intersection. I would not suggest this as an option for anyone traveling to San Clemente.

Summary Heading: WORSE place we have EVER stayed...customer service is nonexistent here!!
Summary: My daughter went down to the front desk to ask for a towel because when we arrived the only other bath towel was on the floor...she was told we couldn't get one until the housekeeping came in at 11 which was coincidently check out time...therefore, one of us were unable to take a shower. The woman/owner I'm guessing was as rude as the guy we had to deal with at check out. I'm guessing we woke the jerk up, as he came out looking totally ruffled, scratching himself. I explained the situation to which he said it nothing, only grunted. Oh, no face mask required here by the employees.  There are so many nice places to stay in this area, please do yourself a favor and pick a different one. I know we will never stay here again and often pass through this area on our ways back to Santa
Room tip: Choose a room at any other establishment!!!

Summary: The staff was completely accommodating to our financial situation, our money got held up at the bank and they did everything they could to make sure our stay was comfortable and fun. They were completely understanding and helped us any way they could, and the room they provided was lovely! Super glad we stayed here, and will definitely recommend and come back when we can!! Thank you to the manager staff, Nick and Jenny were great!!

Summary Heading: A great place to stay with managers who care
Summary: Thank you as always to Nick and Jenny and  their staff for going above and beyond to make sure my stays  with them are perfect.   I look forward to seeing them each and everytime I visit.  It's rare that you get managers who take the time to ask about me personally.  They are the reason I choose to stay w Wyndam/Travel Lodge

Room was GREAT !!   Staff was Very Friendly !  Easy access to Freeway.  Great Location. Parking was underground so we didn't have to go in the Rain to get to the car.  Wish there was a Family Restaurant within walking distance. I would stay there when I travel to that area again to visit family. Close to the Beach and Great Location for ALL the Family Parks in the area.  Most were within 60 miles in any direction.  Room was Quiet and the view was great.  Had a room on the Golf Course side so less noise but had a chance to get a room with a view of the Ocean.  Had it not been Cloudy and Raining I would have taken a room with that view.

Summary Heading: Kind and wonderful proprietors, clean nice smelling rooms
Summary: The proprietors Jenny and her husband were wonderful.  Very accommodating of my crazy schedule of arrivals and checkouts.  Good with recommendations on where to eat.  Very kind and friendly people altogether. Rooms were nice and clean, and smelled nice (bonus!). For what I needed (a place to sleep close to work, and to do a little bit of work) this location and situation were excellent. Watching sunrise or sunset from just outside my room and over the beach were a nice bonus, too.  Just minutes from restaurant hot-spots!

Great room big in size and friendly staff.  Enjoy it being a smaller hotel and you have a great view of ocean or golf course no matter what side you face. They have just remolded the room so no more carpet and nice floor. Refrigerator (Good Size), microwave and a coffee maker is great to have. And the shower in our room was big.

This is an older hotel which could use some refurbishment.  San Clemente is a very expensive town and this place provides a reasonable place to stay.  You get what you pay for and this is a lower budget place.  Bedding could be updated, however everyone was very kind, friendly and helpful. It sits right beside I-5 so there is a lot of road noise, but also an ocean view.  There was no breakfast offering.

You can't put a price on simple kindness. Our hosts Nick and Jenny treated us like family. This was the 4th time we stayed here and we look forward to next years visit. My mother is 86 years old and a little unsteady on her feet. Nick offered her his arm as if she were his own mother. This simple act of kindness made her day.

Me and my girlfriend wanted to get away for the weekend and found this hotel what a great choice . When we checked they where so nice and friendly and so helpful told us what was around .the room was super clean and was very quit it had its own balcony which was super nice .I highly recommend anybody that is traveling or just wants to get away for the weekend this is the place to go the prices where very reasonable!!!! I will be a returning customer 100% , again great hospitality which means a lot when your staying at a hotel

The staff was very welcoming, friendly, and helpful. It is located right off the fwy and close to beach and restaurants, etc. We would stay there again if visiting San Clemente. Parking was easy and free.

Easy and friendly check in service.  Rooms were just what we needed and were bright and clean.  It is close to food and other services like laundry, within one mile.  A short drive to the beach and shops made our day in San Clemente very worth while.

Pics are deceiving. Not as nice, clean or as big as it seemed and quality of property not worth the price charged. Also very little parking, and trucks only fit in the ally behind the property. At least the employees were pleasant and helpful.

I go to San Clemente for work quite often. I decided to stay in the Travelodge this time. I called ahead and asked if the room  was interested in had a balcony and I was told yes.    When I arrive at the hotel the owners had family hanging out and coughing in their TINY lobby(I am being generous calling it that.... It's about 6ft by 10ft.) After traversing the germ ridden 2 steps from the doorway across the room to the counter the owner comes out in full hair dying PPE because she was in the middle of self dying her hair.... at work....  Regardless of being covered in someone elses coughs I think "Hey, some people/places might just have bad first impressions." When I enter the room I realize they had a bad first impression annnd a worse lasting impression . It was about the same

I got here. The lady Jenny at the front desk was dying her hair while checking me in. She was rude and not helpful. My reservation had a balcony and she gave me a room with a hallway instead of a balcony. I went to the bathroom and the toilet was not flushed from the previous occupants.  Health inspection needed!!!!!  Also they need a new front of the house employee. Jenny was one of the most rude people I have ever encountered... and I am a waitress...

This was our second time visiting this location and I’m so glad we did, we stayed for 6 days. The room with the jacuzzi was totally worth it. The lady at the front desk is so polite and accommodating. We will definitely be returning!

Summary Heading: Beautiful location, Extremely friendly and helpful staff - An absolutely wonderful stay!
Summary: The owner (I forgot to ask his name) was extremely friendly and helpful when my girlfriend and I came down from LA to check out San Clemente for a couple of days.  The room had a beautiful view and is walking distance to the beach and plenty of great restaurants.    We were very happy that we chose to stay here, especially due to the kindness and helpfulness of all of the staff.  A++++ Thank you!!

Nick was incredibly helpful checking us in, showing us to our room and giving us great recommendations for the area. We had a gorgeous room with a balcony and it was perfectly clean. Everything about our experience here was perfect!

Stayed one night. Hotel had a noisy air conditioning. Found used underwear in the bathroom from a previous tenant or even someone before. Refrigerator didn’t work. Noisy neighbors. Took forever for the hot water to be hot.

Staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. Highly recommend anyone thinking of staying in San Clemente area. Also plenty to do nearby. Will definitely make a point of staying there again when in the area.

Summary Heading: Travelodge by Wyndham - San Clemente CA
Summary: Our Rooms were clean but small.  Service was great and the owner was very friendly.  Location was Wonderful - right on the main stripe of San. Clemente CA and right next to the Marine Corp. Base.  Checking in and out went smoothly.

My wife, daughter and I had a great time staying at Travelodge in San Clemente. Very clean, fresh coffee and very nice room service. We recommend staying here if your on vacation or buisness trip. 5 stars all the way!!!

The staff here was very nice and helpful during my stay at this hotel. Close to the beach and the pier and surrounded by multiple restaurants within walking distance. Overall the rooms were clean and housekeeping came everyday with fresh towels and cleaned up the rooms.

Pardon the irony with the word “kinda”, perhaps “Really Really” perfect would be more suitable. Of couse, beauty is in the eye of the beholder, and it all depends on what you are looking for. I was on a business trip to LA and had an early morning meeting in nearby Mission Viejo. I had just put my wife and kids on a plane for Paris, where we live, and I was thinking...why not just crash at the airport and get up early and drive to Mission Viejo. But then I thought...ugh. Early morning LA rush hour traffic? So I decided to just bite the bullet and head down there, and stay in a hotel somewhere. On this type of mission I am not picky. I am a bottom fisher. On other types of missions, particularly where my wife is with me, more luxe is required. Natch! And sometimes haut luxe. But

The room was clean - but the hallways and stairwells were dirty and had dropped foodCertain areas smelled - like the front desk - the carpets in the room were worn and the chairs needed to be recoveredMy husband was very unhappy and wanted to leave a day early - but they wouldn’t refund our last days stay

Summary Heading: San Clemente Travelodge Hotel- An economicsl l alternative to expensiv hotels in Dana Point
Summary: A comfortable cozy stay near the ocean , with just enough amenities, without the added expense of a stay in the nearby upscale beach community of Dana Point. San Clemente location offers a nice village downtown area with wonderful shops and restaurants, including a great “ not to miss” pier that makes it all worthwhile for a quick week end getaway of relaxing pleasures   Forget the expense of high hotel costs in Dana Point when you can have it all in a neighboring city just a short 10 minute coastal drive away.

Summary Heading: Manager was pleasant  - but hotel/motel itself, not good at all.
Summary: To be fair, the manager on duty was very courteous however to start, there were no rooms left with two queen beds - which we had reserved for that specific rate. We arrived shortly after check in time and were told no 2 queen bed rooms were left.  And then we were told they do not offer breakfast at this property which was specifically included in our reservation details.The excuse was '2nd party bookings sometimes make mistakes' .... well a good business person would get that corrected asap as surely this was not the first time it happened.  We were told we could look at the room and if we did not like it, we could cancel.  Cancelling at this late date would have resulted in a much higher one night stay rate.  Had we known all of this in advance, we certainly would not have

I have stayed at this Travelodge three times now and have always had the most courteous service and attention from the staff. I originally booked through an outside agency and was not happy with what I was told by them.  So I rang the San  Clemente Travelodge directly and was given a better room at a better price by the manager.  I believe it was his wife who checked us in and, again, I could not have been more pleased with the attention she paid to my friend and I.  We had a superb 2 queen bed room looking out to the sea.  Everything was very clean and we could not have asked for anything more.

We could unfortunately stay only one night in this Travelogue but it was a very nice experience the staff was very helpful and kind in advising the highlights of the city and surroundings, we would do again.

Very clean, spacious room with a terrific ocean view and balcony. Nick and Jenny were extremely helpful and accommodating. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit this town and stay in a centrally-located, beautiful hotel run by a very nice couple.

We stayed in this great hotel again this year, we watch fireworks on 4th of July from our balcony. Jenny and Nick is great people- always eager to help with anything we need. Cleaning ladies very friendly and do their job with detail attentions. Thank you all for making our stay more pleasant, can't wait to be back.

Perfect location for what we were up to.  Close to beach, close to town with lots of dinning and shopping options. Also close to campground the rest of our party was in.  Parking can be a little confusing, but clean facilities, microwave, fridge, etc. In room. Great balcony view.

The gentle man that checked us in was the nicest and most professional person we had met on our vacation. He suggested a few places we could go to eat for dinner and for breakfast in the morning too, we took his suggestion, Molly Blooms Irish pub next door, great food, atmosphere and service too. On our whole trip the higher end resorts/hotels had the most uncomfortable beds, seems strange but true! Always hard a s a rock! Travelodge bed was hands down the best!! Room was spotless and quiet too, THANKS TRAVELODGE for making this part of our vacation wonderful :)

Summary Heading: Overnight stay at the lodge close to the beach with a view
Summary: I had a great experience at this hotel. The owners were extremely pleasant. Jenny greeted me with the nicest personality. She was very conversational and even gave me a great tip on a restaurant nearby which happen to be excellent Seafood. Her husband Nick was also really pleasant. Room was very clean and up to date. I recommend this location to anyone looking for a clean place to rest. Kudos!

The room was clean and a good bed.  Parking is very limited.  Breakfast was very limited. Ocean view room overlooks the very busy highway. Hotel staff was very nice.  Was ok for what we needed but would not stay if on a holiday.

Summary Heading: A night for rest and relaxation
Summary: This is an excellent place to get some deep relaxation... The patio overlooks the ocean and has a great staff... I would highly recommend this property to anyone looking for an Ocean View Property and low prices...  Great PLACE!
"Breakfast" was a canister of cold cereal (one kind only), a few cheap bagged muffins, and coffee.
Everything about my stay was enjoyable.  The room was quiet and comfortable.  Check in and check out was a breeze.  I definitely will stay there again when I am in San Clemente.

This place isn't fancy, but the room was spacious and comfortable. We slept well. High marks for the managers/staff, who were friendly and responsive to all of our questions and requests. The only drawback of the room was the appearance of dust behind and under the beds. Needed closer vacuuming. Also, don't expect much for breakfast--mainly coffee, juice, croissants, and cereal. But the price was very reasonable and the location and parking was convenient.

I was very impressed with the hotel and the service and will definitely be back. When I arrived the owner greeted me very warmly and showed me where to park at night and even upgraded my room. The room itself was very nice - way above average for hotels of this type. There was an ocean view from my room. I was there on business, but I definitely recommend this hotel for a romantic getway.

Summary Heading: Good location to many day trips.
Summary: Clean big room with new walk-in shower. Nice friendly manager who takes a real interest in his property and guests.
Tried to park in an unlabeled space in front was told it was  for the manager only.  The breakfast was very meager. Repairs are needed.

The room photos are not what you will get. If you book through a travel site like Expedia you will get a small room that is on the back of the hotel. The photo of the lobby is deceiving. It is very small with one chair. The luggage carrier is a flat cart like used in a warehouse. A grocery cart would be better. There is no restaurant although it is showed in the amenities. You do not get your AAA, military or senior discount either. Book direct to get any of these for 10% Pris the room was clean.
I had a wedding at a venue near the hotel and this was an excellent cost-friendly place to stay for the night. Nothing overly fancy about the hotel but it was a clean quiet place to sleep.

Like you can tell it needed some repairs because of age and probably some stupid customers, but it was so clean and everyone was so nice, no one bothered us, they gave me advice well information about places to go visit while I waited to see my man on base, and everything was stocked we didn't run out of things for the whole week I was there... I will go back whenever my daughter and I visit Cali again

The bigger rooms were nice, however Ive stayed in a queen room on the first level and it was ok. The complimentary breakfast could be better, I would recommend at least two cereal options and two pastry options.

This travelodge is a bit older, but in a good state of repair. Located close to many SoCal points of interest, especially including the beach. Numerous eateries line Camino Real in close proximity to the motel. Lacking a space for the breakfast is a minor inconvenience, but certainly not worth scratching this location over. Far too many pluses to mention, just relax and enjoy.

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay at Traveloge on El Camino Real !
Summary: We stay at Traveloge for 5 nights and we definitely coming back again. Excellent service, great people, clean and fresh room, great location. Friendly attitude. Thank you Jenny and Nick! I am recommending this hotel to all my friend and relatives.
This motel is ON 5.  Very noisy all night long.  The bed was very comfortable, & the room a little dated.     The staff very helpful, and overall a good stay. Our room was clean & comfortable.

If all you need is a place to sleep, then this works. It is about 5 minutes from downtown, and just a few more minutes to the beach.  The traffic on PCH and the freeway are noisy, but if you sleep with the air conditioner on it takes care of it.  The place is very run down though, so if you are the type of person that likes to rest or spend time in your room other than sleeping, I would stay elsewhere.

Not at all what it looks like in the pix. Price was $150/night and this was a sketchy, nasty roadside motel. I paid extra for an ocean view. What I got was a great view of the roof and a bit of water way far away. The only thing updated was the shower. The blankets were a 70's throwback and there was no double sheeting either. Our AC leaked all over the ground and you cannot get anything overnight, so don't bother. I was scared to park-which there are only like 5 places in the underground parking. Otherwise you're parking in the alley behind the hotel. Checkout is 11:00 am and by 10:30 we were being harassed for not yet checking out. No worries. We will not be returning.

Summary Heading: If a view of the freeway is your definition of beauty:(
Summary: This hotel did not look like the picture! Just a super old place, I would never recommend this to ANYONE!
Although reasonably priced, lobby smelled like an Indian restaurant and room  felt old and dirty.  I guess you definitely get what you pay for.

Nothing special but the room was clean and the location right off of Interstate 5 was convenient for my one night stay while awaiting my vacation rental.  Parking in the back was convenient but if you are concerned about security, note that the room doors are very open to the public

The travel lodge is an older building so it's appearance is nothing special. It's in a location that is easily accessible from the highway. It was quiet and the room was clean.  The owner was very friendly and helpful. It was reasonably priced for the area. If you are only planning on spending a night or two I would recommend this hotel as you are probably not in town to spend time in your room but to get out and enjoy the location!

Summary Heading: Room: As Expected  Check In:  As Suspected
Summary: The room was as described by others -- Spartan, dated, but clean.  The breakfast is a bottle of water and a granola bar.  It's right next to I-5, but we were able to sleep fine with the door and window fully closed.  My two recommendations are that the towels could be a bit more plush, and to stop treating guests like suspects--a valid credit card and a quick look at a driver's license should be all that is necessary.  Requiring guests to write all info on a check in card that was previously entered on the Internet reservation is unnecessary, and the copying of the driver's license is slow and uncool.  Maybe you've been stiffed by some cash paying guests, but a valid credit card should provide adequate assurance.

The staff was very nice and helpful. The location while easily accessible is very near the expressway so there is a lot of traffic noise, but since I live close 2 an airport that did not bother me. What was disruptive 2 sleep was the loud couple in the adjoining room talking loudly until 3 a.m. The door connecting the 2 rooms which were locked was not solidcore so the noise of the tv and conversation echoed into our room until the wee hours. The owner was extremely hospitable.
This is a nice beach front property, if you want a comfortable stay request 3rd floor room.  The first floor needs updating and is well below the quality of the top floor.

Nick was so kind and courteous - I stayed in my room and rested, and he called me late in the day to make sure I was OK.  I love this Travelodge - I've stayed here before.  The only constructive comment I'd make is that the bathroom is too small/too tight.  But a great place to stay.

We needed a nice place to sleep for 2 nights that didn't break the bank. We used our Wyndham Rewards and got a great price on a room.  Ocean View really means "view"...you can see the ocean from our room.  Close to I-5 but not TOO loud; we were on 3rd floor.  Sort of hard to get to, if you don't know back roads...GPS is terrible for direct directions to somewhere; ask the hotel staff to direct you.  The owners were great and very friendly.  Room was nicely decorated and clean.  Parking off road was nice, too.

It was a quick overnight stay. Good location right off freeway and close to a beautiful beach and the pier area. Management very accommodating. Bedding, linens, and towels should be updated, but price was right!

Summary Heading: Small Chain Motel on Main Thru-Street
Summary: Small budget-style motel on El Camino Real but walkable to the seashore via several directions. Rooms would be considered cramped to some.  A couple of things to point out, though. The price quoted at check-in was more than what I had agreed to when I reserved. It seems there's an additional charge for a room safe. If you don't argue it off, you'll wind up paying the premium. I find it strange that the Wyndham chain allows such financial hi-jinx. Also, a few homeless vagabonds like to snuggle up in the corners of the downstairs parking shelter at night. They're generally harmless but, still, disconcerting. The snack breakfast can be skipped. Find something better on or near Via Del Mar.

Summary Heading: My Favorite Place in San Clemente
Summary: This Travelodge is so warm and friendly.  The rooms on the 2nd floor that face the ocean are so nice. The cost is so reasonable for what you get.  I will always stay here in San Clemente... as you can walk to the beach, shopping, and cute little restaurants.  You will have to drive a little to the main pier and beach... but you are there in less than 2 minutes.
Great for a quick overnight stay. Sheets were thin and the room was a tad chilly, but overall I can't complain.

I came on short notice to attend to my mother who went into hospice and subsequently died during my visit. It was very difficult. The manager remembered my name and went out of his way to accommodate my needs. I am getting older myself and traveling alone was difficult. I felt as if I was staying with family. The refrigerator was very nice and having a microwave made it possible for me to meet my strict diet.

Old run down but cheap.  Not as pictured.  Surprised it is a Wyndham property.  On the day of check out the front desk called our room at 10:15am to see if we were checking out or staying.  Very strange when checkout is 11am.  Bed to sleep in at a cheap price but not where we will stay again. Very loud and no heater.
Rooms are Ok average, No room for Breakfast one table by the stairway with cookie and coffee one pot of juice poor breakfast, noisy by the freeway.

We stayed here during our Thanksgiving break. Staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean. The bathroom needs to be updated, missing bathtub plug, no fan. Our daughter had to take a shower instead of her normal bath. Our room faced the freeway, noise wasn't bad with the heater on to block out car noise. We also had a view of the ocean and nice sunsets. Not a bad place for 1-2 nights.
A quiet hotel in a great location, comfortable beds & private balconies, plenty of parking.. and the owners could not have been nicer or more accommodating :)

The photo of the Hotel on line doesn't look anything like what the building looks like at this time... it's a very old Hotel, but nice and clean on the inside.  Room was clean and nicer than the outside of the building.  Was a little worried at first sight, but the owners / manager was really nice and the trip went very well.  Doesn't have a pool on site, but the beach in just a hop away!
Our room was fine for what we paid. Management was friendly. Property was very quite.  Continental breakfast failed to our liking.

I've never slept more soundly in a hotel as I have this one, superb bed! If we ever do manage to make it back I'd love to try a 2ND story room with a balcony. The man at the front desk who checked us in & out was more than friendly, helpful & accommodating. Everything was simple & sweet!
Slept in my clothes on top of sheet. Didn't use bathroom. Dirty with hair and water smelled like sewer. Felt totally unsafe and disgusted

We stayed here for four nights,the manager Nick and his staff were very nice and helpful. He even went Above n Beyond to help us out in anything we needed in order to make our family stay more pleasant.

Summary Heading: Old stinky place. Not worth the money
Summary: People were friendly but hotel is old and there is a strong smell of Indian food in all common areas. Breakfast is very light and it's takeaway. No pool. Not worth the 140+ $ we paid for

I wish someone had post an honest review about this place before we endured a night here. It is dirty, old, questionable as far as personal safety and smells disgusting.  The beds are hard as rocks, my sheets had holes in them and the blanket looked like it had been around as long as the hotel.  When we checked in we were hit with an overpowering smell of East Indian cooking, and while I enjoy a good curry, this odor was clinging to the walls and me after a moment in the room (it was even more offensive to have that smell smack me in the face when I checked at 6:30 the next morning). The woman behind the counter was having an argument with someone on the phone; she never acknowledged us but went into the back room and brought a man out that looked to be her son; he was pleasant
Spent most of the time outside the room.   Slept only.  Accommodations for that and location were very good.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with a good location and affordable pricing!
Summary: I stayed the Travelodge for just one night.  The front desk gentlemen, Nick, was of great assistance.  He was very nice and offered my a good rate.  He even mentioned that he worked out deals with local restaurants for a discounts if you were staying at the Travelodge.  The bathroom seemed to be newly renovated and the bed was comfortable, which is not easy for me to way with a bad back.  I recommend this hotel.

Really outstanding service getting me a room even though I came at 3 in the morning. I owe them for keeping me away from sleeping in my car and they are so kind! Pretty easy parking and good wifi. BOOK IT!
Older room and decor.  Did not eat their breakfast.  Outside very clean.  Check in very nice Mold in bathroom.  One tiny bottle of shampoo, Bath needed more cleaning.

Summary Heading: Great Location for Wedgewood San Clemente
Summary: Check-in was very efficient, The room was very clean and spacious,  Perfect for walking to Wedgewood San Clemente.  The only draw back was the adjacent Freeway and resulting noice.

A very nice place to stay in San Clemente for every reason... friendly and warm staff in the office, location to beach, location to shopping/restaurants on the El Camino Real.  I would go back there for sure as I am looking to move to San Clemente this year and will be making visits to accomplish this.

Summary Heading: Clean rooms great hospitality provided by owners and staff
Summary: I prefer staying here over most other places in San Clemente... Close to the beach and the best muni golf course on the so cal coast.
The room was nice but it was on top of the freeway and the noise was so loud all night long. Ocean view?

Very nice accommodations,the room was clean and the Hotel was well kept. A beach view, and the nicest staff. Jenny in particular was very kind,of course the breakfast is good but with a coffee maker in the room and a fridge,I was very comfortable.  I will be back!

This was nothing like what we expected when we got there and we were pretty disappointed, but because we were using our free points we figured we would just tough it out.  We hadn't had a weekend away for a long time, so when I booked it I was careful to look through the pictures of the room before I chose our hotel.  This was supposed to have a bathtub and shower, I have lupus so it helps to soak for me, there was no bathtub just a walk in shower that smelled horrible.  We also expected to have a ocean side balcony, it was one of the reasons that we chose the room.  It did not, it had a public balcony that everyone shared and everyone smoked on, and the view of the ocean was there, but it was more distant than advertised.  Over all, the staff was kind and friendly, but the room
Manager Response: We are sorry to here that you needed a bathtub. We have some rooms with bathtub and some with bathtub and shower available. If you had asked the front desk for a room with a bathtub, we would have gladly met your request by changing your room. We regret that we were not given an opportunity to meet your needs.

Summary: The front desk staff is very personable and welcoming.  I recommend the second floor, facing the golf course (it's quiet).  Free wifi worked well (which is important).  I didn't try the breakfast while I was there. Walkable to restaurants, bars, 7-11, near a gas station, too.  It's about a 20-minute walk to the beach.
If possible,  request the top floor rooms which have a great ocean view. Also, from the top floor, you won't hear the freeway noise. Traffic noise can be loud from the lower floors.

Summary Heading: Inexpensive price for an older hotel near the freeway
Summary: We stayed here on a last minute Expedia deal.  The location is just east of I5 and our room, while spacious and having a balcony, only had a view of the frontage road and the I-5 highway.  The room was large with a king size bed and sitting table.  There was free wi-fi , a microwave and a fridgeas well as a flat-screen TV with cable.  It's older and worn but clean.  The bed needs a new mattress.  Given the location, we kept the room AC on to provide some white noise.  Noise insulation between rooms was poor and we could hear their shower and the guy above walking on his floor.  Cookies, bagels, coffee and juice in the morning near the lobby.  No pool or Jacuzzi.  Parking is available below the building and in back.  We had no trouble finding a parking spot.  The staff was

Summary Heading: Stayed at the Travel Lodge for 15 years on and off
Summary: I first stayed there in 2000 and I missed a couple years but stayed every winter for 15 years. I stayed in almost all the rooms in that place over the years. Yes some rooms were better than others but all in all I was very happy at the hotel. Close to everything and all the staff are wonderful. Clean and safe.

Very affordable for the San Clemente Area. We stayed one Saturday night in February and got lucky with this awesome hotel. You're a short 5 minute ride to the downtown area.  The room itself was clean and spacious, the staff was also very friendly, Highly Recommend!!

Due to a mix up with customer service we did not stay there. I wNted to stay there on Saturday but she made the reservations for Friday. She mentioned that she would email me a confirmation but I never received it. So we where very surprised when we got there on Saurday to find out all of this. They did say they had one more room but it was 60 more then what I had paid already so we left.

Very helpful staff!  We had a great stay for a friends wedding.  Would recommend for a budget hotel.  There was nothing too special about the hotel other than the welcoming and helpful staff.  Great location as well.

Easy access to hotel, Room 209 was an King suite with Jacuzzi tub, shower separate from tub, sitting area, large LG Flat screen TV, microwave-coffee maker-refrigerator-in room safe, comfortable chairs and dinning table, balcony with chairs end table smoking allowed, view ocean over 5 freeway, Manager/Owner very helpful, very nice polite,

For what we paid, we had a nice ocean view. We were only there to sleep and not hang out so it was a good fit for us. The hotel is very small, no pool and no health spa. The breakfast was what we expected for a continental. All in all, it was a nice get away. The only thing we didn't know is that they don't have hair conditioner. We did hear the people next to us during the middle of the night making noise so plan on bringing earplugs.

Summary Heading: Visited my doughter´s family and stayed 19 nights in Travelodge San Clemente
Summary: In this hotel all personel were very helpfull and kind. As I am sensitive for several chemicals, it helped me a lot that there were no chemicals used in my room. Also bed was very comfortable and my back liked it as well. As my room view was to golf course, there was no traffic noise at all. Will return to this hotel next year if I have the possibility to visit my grandchildren for Xmas again.

Top rated hospitality by staff. Very helpful and surf friendly. Location close to highway and Trestles surf(dawn patrol!). Accommodations basic and dated. Location close to town center, local surf shops, food, etc. Price is reasonable considering average accommodation with easy access to Trestles(dawn patrol!).

I wasn't expecting much, but wow! The owner of this hotel was outside waiting for his guests. He asked the reason for my stay(wedding) he asked if it was a specific wedding and I said yes, he informed me that many guests of that wedding were staying there as well. I was early and he said he needed 15 minutes for the room to be ready; so I asked him where I could grab some food and a drink while I waited. He gave me so many options. Once I got to the room wow, super clean and huge! I didn't need that much but for the price it went above and beyond.

Summary Heading: Good location, good sized rooms, balcony's for smoking
Summary: Originally we were not going to stay at this hotel because they are listed as no smoking. But all the rooms have balconies you can smoke on so we gave them a try. The rooms are good sized, with large sliding glass windows for a good view. Ocean view on one side, golf course view on the other. Breakfast is skimpy but that's not why we stay. If the hotel is full parking can be tight, but if it's not full you can park underground and get right to your room. Very good staff/GM at this hotel! Very knowledgeable about the area, friendly, will do what it takes to help. Probably biggest plus is their manager! If Travelodge is a hotel level you are comfortable with - this one will not disappoint.

3rd floor room was clean and nice, and the distant view to the ocean was more than I'd expected. On-sight management was exceptionally nice and helpful at suggesting local scenery, and we will happily stay again to visit family there. Also, just came from 6 nights at the Venetian / Las Vegas, but slept BETTER the 2 nights here at the Travelodge.

Summary Heading: Clean but needs a little work
Summary: Staff was friendly and helpful, room as clean but the bathroom door wouldn't close all the way, like it was too small for the door frame, leaving a small sliver where you could see out. looked like they had poorly painted the bathtub and shower walls. Towels were thin and scratchy. Air conditioning worked well and we had a nice patio. Hotel was quiet. Beds and pillows we're comfortable and seemed new.

First of all, I want to let everyone know that the pictures of the hotel on the Wyndham Rewards website are not reflective of the actual hotel. I learned this lesson when I arrived. It was not what was promised. This is a small hotel with no more than 30 rooms and it has a great view over I-5 and to the Pacific Ocean. I stayed on the third/top floor. Several positive things: there are a number of good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Also, the view is nice. The hotel manager was really kind and friendly, as well. However, the hotel has guest access issues. It probably should be converted into apartments, to be honest. There is an elevator, though it is slow and smelly. The stairs lead down to the lobby. The hotel is old, guests have to go through the tiny lobby

Excellent, warm, and welcoming hospitality Nick and the crew- we thank you for everything including the sun umbrela;) I recommend for you travellers to give there a visit especially surfers. Nick and the crew will take care of you

Incredibly accommodating staff.  Free breakfast. Average room. Small bathroom with one of those unsanitary rubber mats in the tub.  Good location, close to the beach.  Free parking - a real PLUS in San Clemente!

I stayed at this Travel Lodge due to handicap needs.  The welcome was very nice, the bathroom just what I needed (beautiful with a non-generic shower).  The hosts were very accommodating.  I do think the morning  coffee room was not very good  The offering was very limited.  Visited  family where the conditions were not accessible for  my limitations.  I would stay here again.

I am a frequent traveler and stay at different hotels every week. I decided to try the Travelodge as my other comfort hotels were not in the area. The room came with a continental breakfast which was atrociously substandard. When a customer is spending roughly $200 a night, a decent breakfast should not be unreasonable. I would not stay here again.

Summary Heading: Travelodge  In San Clemente Was Awesome!
Summary: San Clemente Travelodge was Awesome! They went above and beyond to service our needs, Gave us a room to change clothes in until our room was ready, even accommodated a friend of ours who needed a room last minute and their customer service was top notch!

The hotel was overpriced. It was horrible, dirty, dingy smallest room we have ever stayed in., the bed was uncomfortable, the man at the desk ran upstairs to open the window before we got to the room. The room was to be no smoking, but clearly there was smoke in this room. It stunk. A/c was very loud, the breakfast was terrible, nothing to choose from and nowhere to drink the coffee. The only good thing about this hotel was the underground parking, and that was even very limited, if you weren't in early I don't know where you would have parked the car. I would not recommenced or ever stay here again! Oh and the so called wifi, don't even try to get on.

We were passing through and needed a place for the night.  I just want a clean place and our room met that need.  Jenny helped us at the front counter.  Very nice and welcoming.  The room we stayed in (3rd floor, on the end) was designed without a bathroom door, so the tub is visible from the bedroom.  (Toilet area does have a door). I didn't really care about the odd design since I was just passing through the area but I can see how it could be awkward.  Not a bad stay.

Summary Heading: If you just want somewhere to sleep and nothing else...
Summary: The owners of this Travelodge were nice enough...but was it enough to make up for all the lack? The wifi was non-existent which was aggravating...it would connect but never load. I stayed in room 304 which had ocean views...it was right next door to the golf course where I was attending a wedding which was very convienient. It is right next to a freeway so no opening the windows because of the noise...which was a bummer because the beach was close by.I would not stay at this hotel again, it had the bare minimum of ammenities and the wifi issue irritated me...the continental breakfast consisted of croissant, oatmeal cookies,orange juice & coffee...none of which were spectacular. If you just want to pass out somewhere it works and was a lot cheaper than the hotel next door.

We were at the travel lodge for a wedding.  We checked in late because we were working on the wedding .. The receptionist at the hotel called numerous times on my cell phone to confirm our arrival. She let the guest check in without the signature of the card holder and then proceeded to call and knock on my guests door.  When asked to stop...she yelled over the top of me during our conversation.

Very friendly and helpful hosts. Rooms are spacious and clean and had everything I needed. Convenient location to access beach and highway. Owners went out of their way to help us and made us feel very welcome. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel while visiting our friends. i first want to say that the husband and wife were very nice but the smell of Curry was over powering when you walk in the lobby for check in. The continental breakfast was not anything like the other Travel lodges my family has been to where it is nicley layed out with many more choices.  A cart was squeezed  in the stair way area that had a coffee pot, plate of crossants, jar of cookies, a few apples and raisin bran.   The area where it is located is right off the freeway and with that being said, don't take the  the up grade of a balcony that faces the freeway.This was not at all pleasant expecially when you wanted to sleep. We had them change our room to the back side of the hotel which  is an alley way that divides the

For the price per night, I was highly disappointed. The owner was very sweet and friendly but the rooms are outdated and cheap. There is a small parking structure but it was empty so we found parking. We booked the honeymoon suite which advertised a king bed, refrigerator, hot tub, balcony, ocean view, etc. The room was an awkward layout, no closet, no iron, bathroom was dingy and hot tub was awfully outdated and gross. The ocean view was really the freeway with the ocean far behind. I was embarrassed to have booked this for my boyfriend and I. For $150 a night, this was more of a cheap motel. The breakfast was just Danishes, OJ, and coffee in a tiny room with nowhere to sit and eat. I would never stay here again! The only good thing was the location. It was within 2 blocks of

We needed a reasonably priced, clean, and safe location near the North Gate of Camp Pendleton. Staff outstanding; going out of their way to meet our needs and make our first stay in the area enjoyable.  Easy access (some highway noise, but we didn't mind); enjoyed the second floor balcony with ocean in view.

Summary Heading: I will return on my next visit to San Clemente...
Summary: I stayed at this hotel last fall and was happy enough to repeat last week. The entire place is very clean and well maintained. Every one of the staff, from housekeepers to management, was very friendly and helpful.   This is not a new hotel, but it has been maintained well and has nice upgrades. The bed was very comfortable; the room (including bath) was spotless. The linens were fresh and nothing looked old, worn or funky. My room had a balcony on the beach (and freeway) side. Yes, it's noisy, but I do enjoy sitting there with a view of the ocean. The room had a fridge, micro, coffee maker and nice TV. Also a table and three chairs. Overall, very comfortable and the price was reasonable. My stay was so pleasant, I suspect I will book again for my next trip to San Clemente.

Summary Heading: Great location near beach, very friendly management, terrific value
Summary: Girlfriend and I stayed here on a surf trip and thought it was the perfect spot. Amazing value for location, rooms clean and welcoming. And the management were so kind and very warm. Strongly recommend!

Summary Heading: Overall very good but odd noise.
Summary: I'm sensitive to noise anyway but there was an odd machine like noise that seemed to come from the room near us. I was able to sleep well enough and didn't call the office because I didn't want to wake my husband who didn't notice it. It sounded possibly like a washing machine or generator. The breakfast was fine but by 9 it was very picked over and the coffee was gone but I got more at the desk. The location and view of ocean and breeze is very nice and the people working there were helpful. I would recommend it but if you are sensitive to noise bring a sleep aid or ear plugs. It's also next to the freeway.

It cost me about $94 to stay here for 1 night, on a non weekend. I enjoy taking a hot bath, but they only had a shower. Cable tv channels were a very small variety, nothing really good. The continental breakfast that they claim to have is a joke ! Raisin bran, orange juice, chocolate donuts. When I checked out, an unshaven man that looked like he was in his robe and slippers took my key and did not even give me a receipt. There is no pool or spa on the property. I like that it was close to the freeway, and the weather near the beach is fantastic !  But overall, I do NOT recommend this property to anyone. It needs some Major upgrades !

Although comfortable and spacious, this facility is an older one with dated amenities.  Their "continental breakfast" offerings are sparse and limited. While staying there in April 2015, on our second day there, although staying in, we were disappointed that their housekeeping staff did not approach us with an offer to clean our room and we had to approach the front desk for additional items (water & coffee cups and an extra towel.
Street noises kept me up, a couple two rooms down fighting all night,bathroom smaller then a prison cell.however staff was very nice as they can be room was very small.

Summary Heading: Very run down and not that clean
Summary: When I turned the bed spread the one cover was very dirty (looked like blood) on the underside and were very wrinkly like they had not been washed in a while (the other one was diirty also) I tracked the cleaners down in the hallway to put clean ones down.. In the bathroom the tile beside the tub was rotten under neath and kept bending down like it was gonna crack. The neighbours above us were us walkin around night long.

Summary Heading: I will definitely be coming back!
Summary: Extreamly welcoming managers, friendly staff and immaculate rooms, everyone really went above and beyond to make sure I enjoyed my stay. I will definitely be staying at the San Clemente Travelodge on any future trips to California. I could not praise this place enough for its wonderful service.

Me senti em casa, os donos são adoráveis e super atenciosos! Com certeza irei voltar a este hotel!  I felt home. Nick and Jenny are lovely! Near to the best wave in cali, Trestles!!!  For sure i will be back to Travelodge San Clemente!

Summary Heading: Have stayed every year for many years and have never had a...
Summary: Have stayed every year for many years and have never had a complaint; always great service from friendly people.

Summary Heading: Pay the extra $25 and go somewhere else
Summary: I literally booked this room just to sleep in for about 6 hours before heading out to catalina for a few days just so we would not have to fight traffic monday morning. It was horrible! Dirty, dingy and the most uncomfortable bed ever. I imagine prisons have better cleaner beds than this. Needless to say we slept on the bedding and not in it.  Also the office staff did not seem to like the fact that we were dropped off by an  uber driver. He isisted we use his buddies taxi service in the am. He actually followed us out to the curb to try to talk us into using the taxi instead. Luckily uber showed up in about 1 minute and we jumped in and left while hd stood there (right next yo me) while the driver and my bf loaded the luggage. Talk about pushy.

Stay away from this place, do yourself a favor.  We spent 1 night here and it was horrible. The room was facing the highway which made it impossible to sleep. It was so dusty and dirty in the room that my boyfriend had to take anti histamines for his dust allergy as it was so bad. Also we found hair EVERYWHERE in the room - in the shower, in the sink and on the bed. We called reception and a lady came by, and after we showed her the dust, she asked with an attitude if when my boyfriend walks outside he also has allergies because the air carries dust - disgusting attitude. So after we realized that this was just the poor standard of this place, we cleaned up a bit and sucked it up. Bottom line, disrespectful guest treatment, dirty and bad.

We had to opportunity for a small, close to home, overnight get away to celebrate our anniversary.  For what we needed the hotel was fine, a place to stay overnight comfortably.  The room was clean, the spa tub was really too small for 2 but the rest of the amenities were good.  We didn't get down to the small breakfast they offer so I cannot comment on that.  The staff was nice.  Be forewarned about parking, if you drive a larger vehicle you'll need to park around back.  We had to drive through the Hampton Inn, not quite next door to get to the alley in the back.  Plus, the back parking lot was full by the time we returned from dinner and had to park on the street parking.  It wasn't a bad option, just know that this may affect you.  The hotel met our needs and the staff was

Summary Heading: The people that worked there were friendly. It just looks a...
Summary: The people that worked there were friendly. It just looks a little nicer in the picture then the person. Not worth the money.

Summary Heading: Overnight stay, Travelodge, San Clemente CA
Summary: On rather short notice, we booked an overnight stay at the Travelodge at San Clemente, CA. Checking in early, we upgraded to a slightly larger room and were pleased with the result: a clean, nicely outfitted, room with quite a bit of space along with convenient parking on the back side of the motel.   My wife and I were impressed by the courtesy and friendliness of the motel operator and his wife. They went out of their way to suggest good places to eat for dinner and breakfast (the next day) along with providing local area maps and guides.  We had breakfast the next morning at the local place suggested and couldn't have been more pleased.
This Travelodge at San Clemente Beach is very nice and clean. There is a breakfast, but we went to The Sugar Shack a few blocks north of the motel. Absolutely excellent!
Average hotel in good location, staffed by first class people who went out of their way to make sure our stay was enjoyable.

The couple attending the place are awesome, we have a baby and care about us, gave us a crib and help us with everything we need. The room was great and clean, there's everything we need to have a good time here. We really recommend this place!!!

Summary Heading: Great Stay at a Great Value....
Summary: The room was awesome and extremely spacious, huge Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom along with a stand alone shower and a private balcony... I loved the room.. The staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable of the area and activities.. Great Staff, Great Room, Great Stay.. Thanks Mick and staff.. I will return..

The location is good, right off of the highway and just a few minutes from base.  The onsite managers are really what sets this place apart.  They are very friendly and incredibly helpful.  My schedule during the stay was irregular, but they went out of there way to be accommodating.  I would highly recommend to anyone looking for an inexpensive, quality hotel.

Don't let the pictures fool you! this place is a dump! The room was dirty! the blanket had stains and also a foot print on it! there were peanut shells on the floor, obviously they did not clean this room! I couldn't switch hotels because it was already reserved and we would lose our money! This place is nasty! it smells nasty too! specially in the "lobby/office" area! At 8am we woke up to the sound of our window shaking, most like from the vibration of an AC going on because there was no type of construction going on, I called the front desk to complain about it and they did not care! These people running this place are not very polite they only care about making money!

Very friendly staff - easy to get to because it's just off freeway.  Noise on the freeway side rooms was bothersome.  I kept the A/C on just to keep the road noise covered.  This property needs renovation and updating.  For the money, I would've hoped for better.   Breakfast there was forgettable; we chose to go elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Friendly, economical, excellent value for the area!
Summary: The onsite managers, Nick and Jenny,  were friendly, caring people.  The accomodations are clean and the breakfast was filling, which is included in the cost.  We would definitely visit this Travelodge again!  It is easy to find and near wonderful places to visit and multiple eateries and shopping.  We enjoyed visiting the surfing beach, Tresles, known for it's world class surfers.  It was amazing and beautiful to watch.  The hotel isn't far away from many attractions.
Room was clean,front desk were polite. If you want quite your at the wrong place, we could here freeway traffic all night

Summary Heading: The staff are extremely friendly and helpful.  The hotel...
Summary: The staff are extremely friendly and helpful.  The hotel while old is clean and in a perfect location for visiting friends and family at Camp Pendleton.

There were clean linens, the bed was comfortable, very quiet, and close to everything.  The best part though was that the staff was extraordinary.  Very polite, friendly, accommodating, and knowledgeable about the area.  Someone checked our room right after checkout and immediately brought down a forgotten item to us.  Great service!!!!
Bathroom stool loose - sink drain very slow - shower control almost impossible to operate - no tub drain stop
Excellent on/off freeway location for entrance to ITB/MCT facilities at Camp Pendleton on Basilone Road.  Reasonable pricing.

Summary Heading: A nights stay on Interstate 5's fastlane
Summary: If you are :"hard of hearing" and don't mind your bed literally shaking from the Semi's flying by on the interstate ALL night long, then this place is for your.    For the price it did have a clean room and shower but the location is terrible.   Did I mention my bed shook from the Semi's going by ALL night long.
This was a good value for the money.  Our door latch did not work the second night so we got a new room, even better than the one we had, which was very nice.

Summary Heading: Comfortable bed, bad breakfast, tired and noisy
Summary: The hotel is located pretty close to the i5 freeway. I didn't mind this but if you don't like traffic noise then avoid. Overall the hotel and room was pretty tired but not unclean. The bed was comfy and everything worked. The staff were polite but they did eyeball us when we went down for breakfast, which was a very unappetising, sparse selection of sugary donuts, cookies and not much else. Can't recommend based on this for the price.

Summary Heading: a gem close to the beach
Summary: I especially liked the couple who manages this place.  they are efficient and personable.  the rooms are clean.  the building tho older is well kept in many ways.

Summary Heading: Hotel Failed to Honor Timely Cancellation
Summary: I made a reservation on August 27 2013 for travel in September; I cancelled the same day.  I have been charged even though I made the timely cancellation.  The hotel called me, I confirmed I had cancelled and there was a mistake on their part; they charged my credit card nonetheless.  Rudely, I might add.
Manager Response: The reservation was never cancelled by the guest prior to check-in date. For all cancellations made prior to 24 hours of arrival, the central reservation center or the property will issue a cancellation number. According to our property records you made reservations for 2 nights and you did not show up. We charged you for the first night only and we made a courtesy call to you after 1st night to inform you that we will cancel the 2nd night only.

Summary: I loved this place. reasonable and clean, had an ocean view. I will stay here again. staff was friendly.

Summary Heading: Really friendly owners,clean and big room.
Summary: It was my first time to come LA and San Clemente. We went there with my 2friends and we shared the biggest room. The room was really big. shower is always works good. I'll come back here next year for sure.

I needed to stay about equidistant between LA and San Diego, and San Clemente filled the bill.  Travelodge is often too much of a "budget" hotel, but this small hotel's accommodations and physical condition were very good for budget lodging.  The room was clean, well-equipped and spacious; many of the rooms, like mine, apparently have balconies that look toward the sea (admittedly, over Interstate 5!).  Elevators and stairs were both in good, convenient condition.  Parking out back was a bit quirky, using much of the alley, but it was close and serviceable.  Several restaurants and stores were easy walking distance.  The access to I-5 was superb.  The hotel personnel were most friendly and helpful; they clearly took pride in their property.

Summary Heading: Nick and Jenny are great hosts!
Summary: Jenny and Nick did all possible to care for our needs.  They were knowledgeable about the surrounding eateries and beaches. Nick told us about a special beach toward Laguna that sounded great but it was a bit foggy and we decided to do something else.  El Mariachi was authentic Mexican Restaurant.  Great atmosphere.   My sister and I enjoyed our stay!

Summary Heading: Only because we needed a bed
Summary: Just an average experience for the money - The entire motel smelt musty and our room had very stale moist odour beds hard and old linens threadbare. Not up to the standard for the cost
Although an older property, it has been well maintained, is well appointed and clean.  Staff was friendly and most accommodating. Good location, good price, good stay.

We started in San Diego and worked our way up the coast.  No plans, No agenda!  The most taxing thing we did for the week was find a place to stay for the following night.   Nick and Jenny were The most gracious and helpful staff members we have ever encountered! The room was large and clean. A 3 minute car ride to the beach with parking and showers!  We would gladly stay again.

I could easily see the pot bud on the floor between the bed and nightstand from across the room when I first walked in. Every corner, nook and cranny had some bit of garbage. Apparently it's only where the vacuum fits that gets cleaned, and the nozzle attachments don't get used. Breakfast was a joke, and the cart they served it on created a fire hazard as it blocked the stairway. On arrival at dinner time the lobby was thick with curry which permeated into our room above. Parking was an issue also as they didn't want you to parking in the garage downstairs yet there were no spaces behind the building. I parking in the garage anyway. You're right on I-5 so the road noise is bad and using the noisy air conditioner is required. Bad for us Orange Co. had a blackout that night so

This hotel was a nice place for the price. I was in town for a wedding and the location of the Travelodge was perfect walking distance from everything! Even the beach. I appreciated the breakfast. And the employees were incredibly friendly, especially the man who worked at the front desk. I wish I knew his name because he should get a raise. He went above and beyond in customer service. He knew all of our names and greeted us when we would return to our room. He went out of his way to recommend fun things around the area and always offered his assistance to make our stay that much better. He was such a nice person!

The Hyatt Hotel this Travelodge isn't, but if you're looking for a clean room, and great staff/owners, at a rate and value far less than the Hyatt, then this hotel is a great choice. I'm always reluctant to stay in a a travelodge or equally rated hotel, but I would have no reservations about staying at this Travelodge again while visiting San Clemente. I had 2 rooms booked with Wyndham Rewards points, and the Owner, Nick, allowed a early check-in for 1 room, which was about 10am, and just as soon as another became available, then allowed us to check into the other, making sure it was an adjoining room. Keep up the good work Nick!

Summary Heading: Clean, cramped and in need of a face lift
Summary: I was a bit chagrined when I got to this travelodge.  I had picked it for price and reliability of the brand.  There were several hotels nearby and I do wish I had stayed at one of them.  There are times I am spending time with friends and only need a place to sleep.  This was one of them.  It was July 4, so as its a holiday i had few expectations.  But really wish I had gone somewhere the odor of curry did not hang in the air.  We has a golf course view.   That was good.  Golf ears make less noise than the freeway traffic.. This falls into the category of " if the price is cheap enough, you can put up with anything"

Felt like I was a part of the family. Very nice room and service. The owners are very friendly and will bend over backwards to accommodate your stay. Lots of good discounts on nearby businesses, close to stores and shopping. Highly recommended!

The roar of the freeway kept us awake until 2 am. As soon as the traffic on the freeway died down, some folks checked in to the room next to us and talked really loud until 6 am. Got no sleep. Breakfast isn't served until 7 am. Didn't work for us. We needed to be on the road before 7 am.
easy to locate, very  friendly service close to every whim, very clean, desk clerk was really helpful! We will be back.! Nick took a real interest in our stay.

Summary Heading: The Hotel staff was very friendly. I will recommend this...
Summary: The Hotel staff was very friendly. I will recommend this Hotel to my friends. The rooms were clean, I enjoyed my stay very much.

The check in staff seemed fake nice.  Expensive for a Travelodge. Dingy and old. Felt dirty. Not worth it. Next time I'll shell out a little more for one of the boutique apartments by the pier. This place was very far from downtown and the pier.

The staff could not be more friendly! My room was not only cleaned everyday, but they also straightened everything up and made it much nicer to come back after work and not see the mess that I left the room in. Fantastic maid service!

Our stay at Travelodge was great. We have stayed there before, the location for San Clemente and local attractions, including the beach, is great. The value is very good, the managers are awesome, friendly, call you by name, and  are all around helpful.  They remebered us and a Marine family member from Oct. 2011!

Summary Heading: We found the hotel to be very clean, centrally located...
Summary: We found the hotel to be very clean, centrally located, with multiple eating establishments.  The employees were friendly and the accommodations were clean and comfortable. We will definitely stay there again.

This is a typical motel on a street with many motels.  It is a good deal for the price.  I stayed here on a business trip to Dana Point.  This Travelodge was the closest inexpensive motel that I could find.  I just needed a place to sleep and take a shower.  This place fit the bill.  The room was large (much larger than typical for a motel and much more than I needed).  It was clean and the bed was comfortable.  The motel was far enough from the I-5 freeway that there was not much noise.  The layout was a little unusual as the tub/shower was open to the main room.  The room has a typical under-the-window heater/air conditioner.  The room is so big that getting heat to the sink/shower area was a little difficult.  The shower had plenty of hot water.  I was not able to get the

Summary Heading: Not new and flash but wonderful owners and value
Summary: OK OK This motel is old and not new and shiny.  HOWEVER the owners Jenny & Nick go out of their way to really make you feel like family members on a visit.  They are so helpful with restaurant suggestions. Their attitude spills over to the staff.  I love strong coffee and asked for extra.  With a smile the maid went and returned with enough for a week! We stayed here last year and I saved the phone number and called to make my reservation directly just so they'd know they were so fondly remembered.

Summary Heading: Very homey and a great view of the Pacific.
Summary: We really enjoyed the room, the porch, and especially the great view of the Pacific from the room or porch.   And the room had all the amenities you could want, the staff was courteous, and the continental breakfast was simple but adequate.   A great value and we hope we can stay here again in the future.

Okay the hotel isn't in the best condition, but the beds are nice and the rooms are spacious. The best thing are the owners. This was literally the only hotel willing to let us check in early without charging extra. They were so accommodating and nice. If your looking for something that won't break the bank but is still really nice- here it is.
service was great! staff was friendly and extremely accommodating. I would recommend this hotel to any friends staying in the area.

Thankyou to Manager and Manageress for making us so welcome,the room we stayed in was first class ,spacious and spotlessly clean,staff were friendly and helpful,when we come to San Clemente again,this is the Motel we will be heading for,next time i will book in advance!
Location was the best for our train ride and friends visit. Breakfast was a little lacking for choice and missing fruit. Ocean view great and close to water. Would stay again.

The staff at check-in was very rude and unaccommodating of my valid discount. She did not see it as her guest get the best possible experience possible. Upon seeing her later in the day she gave me and my boyfriend a dirty look.

nice little hotel with truly great staff.  the staff there made us feel right at home and we really enjoyed our stay.  we had a nice ocean view room, and we able to walk down to the beach in about 15 min.

Summary Heading: Happy ending to a rough start!
Summary: We stayed at the Travelodge San Clemente Beach on Labor Day weekend.  We had been been down the I-15 down the 8 and up I-5 when we finally found a hotel with vacancy.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  This hotel was way more than we expected.  It was very clean, the beds, bedding, bathroom and carpet.  The beds and pillows were also very comfortable and the room was very spacious.  I would definetly stay here again.

I recently was put into a Motel 6 in Santa Ana that was so filthy that I had an unplanned trip to the E.R.(if there are cockroaches, that should tell you something bad!) and after 1 week there I moved to this Travelodge..A BIG difference! The management (Nick and Jenny)were unfailingly polite and helpful, and their maid staff were very friendly and efficient. Whereas the Motel 6 only cleaned the room ONCE a week(That's right, I said ONCE!) this hotel does DAILY room cleanings and you can tell the difference.I had a nice room with a balcony that had a decent view of the ocean.The only gripe I could site would be a lack of open parking but that is really picking  nits when you take into consideration how good the rest  of the package is.I would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel. Staff is out of this world to accommodate needs!
Summary: I travel ALOT for work and let me tell you the staff at this place is out of this world!!! I checked in about 2am. The manager that was working the night shift really too the extra step to make sure all my needs were taken care of. CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN ROOMS!! I am a really clean freak i was really amazed to see how clean the rooms were. Nice clean bad full pillows. Flat screen tv. Nice view of out side. I WOULD REALLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE FOR MY OWN FRIENDS AND FAMILY.

The San Clemente Travelodge is an older hotel on the city's main drag. It's basic with not too many frills. Space is at such a premium that the Coke and ice machines are outside the lobby in the parking garage.  Honestly, I might have given this rating an "average" instead of "poor" except for the fact that our room reeked of pot. We thought it was a previous guest after the scent went away, but the next morning, it came back in full force, leading us to think it was someone across the hall. Now, hotels can't always control its guests. But we were staying there over Christmas with our family, which made it worse. The staff, though, was nice and accommodating, even adding a lemony scent to our room (perhaps we were a little too subtle in explaining our situation).   Bottom line:

This small hotel met all our needs as my husband and I traveled with our two young kids and my mother. The extended suite was a good size for us, and the breakfasts (included) had a huge selection, including waffles! The staff was friendly and accommodating, and the rooms (and rest of hotel) were very clean. We appreciated the under-hotel parking as well. The outdoor pool and spa were great, too. It was a lovely place to stay!

Summary Heading: If you don't care about creature comforts this will work.
Summary: I stayed her for a weekend for a little R and R.  The hotel is basic and simple with no frills.  You're close the the beach and you can walk to a bar, liquor stores and restaurant (but there is not tons of options)  Be careful when booking because online it acts if the rooms all have balcony's facing the freeway/beach or the parking lot/golf course, but that is not the case.  They have lower end rooms that have no such balcony and designed poorly.  Besides the flat screen TV that was mounted in an odd place where you have to looks left from the bed to watch, there is nothing modern about the rooms. Parking is limited and tight.  They have free continental breakfast but stop serving early, so pay attention.

We stayed at this Travelodge in Beautiful San Clemente California and it was the best time. The room was very spacious with a view of the Golf course, or you could get a room with an ocean view. excellent housekeeping and very very good rates. we checked every hotel in town and the rates here were the best. especially because it was such a clean and beautiful room. Next time I visit San Clemente I wont even bother looking anywhere else I am going straight to this Travelodge. Friendly good people.

We stayed here for a night on our Southern Cali road trip. This motel provided great value and very friendly service. The room was clean, the building is relatively old and close to the highway. This is a motel, not a five star hotel. That said, it doesn't get much better in this price range.

Alright, i honestly cant believe all of the positive comments on this hotels staff. I was treated horribly my entire stay. I was so miserable there that me and my boyfriend left early. They would yell and throw a fit if we had any visitors past 6pm. Not to mention they completely harrassed a couple of our guests. The staff treated our guests like tresspassers and would escort them out to their cars(our guests were nothing but polite). There was a loud get together of some sorts going on down the hall from us as my boyfriend and i were laying in bed with the music on (not too loudly) and they call to tell us we are being to loud. Ridiculous. I cant even put into words how miserable i was. Miserable enough for it to become a joke that this hotel was probably like jail between me
Manager Response: Dear Readers,   We truly apologize for any inconvenience these customers may have undergone. We do our best to make each and every customer’s stay enjoyable and welcoming, and our staff treats everyone with the upmost kindness and respect. As many of our customers can attest, we provide a friendly environment and genuinely enjoy chatting with them throughout their stay. Moreover, we take it upon ourselves to ensure each of our registered guests receive the peace and amenities they are entitled to, including a parking space and easily available access to internet. As a result, we have a large number of returning guests who find our staff helpful and personable.   With all of this in mind, it should be dually noted that these guests violated our basic hotel policies in this particular situation. They attempted to sneak in extra guests through our back entrance and even occupied three (3) parking spots in our limited parking lots. We do not allow guests after 6pm and only offer 1 parking spot per registered guest in order to respect other customers’ right to a space. Additionally, neighboring guests made noise complaints about their room, and it is our responsibility to address such issues and ensure we maintain an appropriate noise level for all customers. In regards to accommodations, these customers specifically chose their room despite our staff warning them that it was the smallest we had available in the array of room options we had to offer. We have always been more than willing to print multiple copies of the internet password for our guests, and take pride in the fact we offer free internet access when most motels and hotels charge for this service. Finally, we do in fact offer a full breakfast every morning, but these guests checked out early (before breakfast was served at 7am).   Again, we are sorry for any hassle these customers experienced as well as for any resulting disturbance our other guests experienced that evening, but we take our motel policies seriously and want to ensure all our guests are treated fairly and given the privacy and access they deserve. We are very warm and hospitable motel conveniently located very close to the beach and downtown area, and we encourage you to come stay with us!   Thank you & Happy Holidays,   San Clemente Beach Travelodge

Summary Heading: Very pleasant stay with great staff
Summary: My friend and I stayed in the Travelodge for 2 weeks. The hotel is close to the beaches and to that great little mainstreet of san clemente (you need a car though). The rooms are well equipted and the beds are fantastic! The beds are upgraded recently and that is noticeble. You sleep excellent. The staff, Nick and Jenny, are the best!. They help you in any way they can and that makes the hotel stay very pleasant and relaxed. I hope to come back soon.

The title San Clemente Beach is a fraud because it's a LONG Way to the Beach.  The location is just l/4 block to I-5, so LOTS of traffic noise. The management is friendly but they don't have much to work with.  The mattress seemed to be new & was very comfortable.  We paid $10 more for a room with an Ocean View which could be seen from a balcony overlooking the street & I-5, then a peek of the Ocean.The pitiful "Continental Breakfast" consisted of:  1 pot of coffee, cream & sugar,  a plate of croissants, -NO BUTTER OR JELLY- 1 choice of cold cereal & a few apples.
