NO JUICES, NO choices of cereals. Other Travelodges offer a choice and it is really not necessary to go out for Breakfast; but this breakfast  is a joke. Summary Heading: Super clean, super polite, super helpful
Summary: The nicest, most helpful people run this place... I ruined my room's cardkey a few times when it brushed against my cellphone, and they barely flinched at my (repetitive) stupidity.  Just super nice, no-nonsense people all the way around.

Me and a surfing buddy stayed here a week. Too far to walk to the beach with a board, but it was ok. Parking was horrible. It was a room to sleep in, which is about all we did. Clean towels and extra coffee everyday like we asked. Service was fine and the place was cleaned daily. Real close to Pedro's taco stand, and the road behind the hotel leads right there. For a place to sleep, it was fine, but I wouldn't take a family there.  for the price it was, not bad. Right off the highway.

Summary Heading: Great if you are a hearing impaired smoker
Summary: I do NOT like to give negative reviews but I wish someone had given me a heads up about this Travelodge. The staff was very sweet and did the best with what they had to work with but  at $150 per night (which I was told at check in was a good deal) I was hoping for the room that was described...non smoking with an ocean view. Although the room was designated  (indeed the entire hotel) as non smoking, it literally reeked of cigarette smoke. The windows did not open.The smoky curtain covered doors opened onto a deck that was literally over the freeway.  My husband and I left the doors open to air out the room but it never actually happened. It was somewhat comical shouting back and forth to each other over the Hwy 101 traffic. .trucks, buses and all. When the clouds lifted on the

We stayed here based on reviews ..... a disappointing stay.  First off, they will charge your credit card before you even get the paperwork filled out.  We had two rooms, both facing the freeway - which is INCREDIBLY noisy.  It was a toss up:  turn on the a/c which sounded like a 747 or leave the door open to hear the traffic - not any difference.  We did have a nice big balcony, but, again - too noisy to even hear each other talk - this went on most of the night and day.  Beds were ok, nothing special.  Bathroom was soooooo small that you almost fall into the tub trying to close the door.  Bath towels were basically see through and thread bare.  You have to sign an agreement that there are no outsiders and parties happening, but then you get a room full of unruly kids next door
Hi, This is a great place for the business traveler. It is quiet, reasonable, and close to the freeway. I also found the rooms to be very clean. The staff is very courteous and helpful also.

Summary Heading: Good price with very nice room & privacy!
Summary: I've actually stayed at this particular Travelodge twice & both times I had a very nice stay. I got a standard room & was upgraded to the suite (with the jet tub) free, since it wasn't occupied & I was staying for a week.  The staff is very friendly and if you ever need something (towels, pillows, soap...etc) they come riht up and give it to you. I had no problems and the room ws spacious and the bed was comfortable. It was not noisey at all, seeing was though it is off of the busy 5 freeway. Very convenient if you need to get somewhere, the 5 is right across the way.  There are restraunts and a local grocery store within 5 minutes from the hotel "Ralphs". Right next door there's a "mart", gas station & behind is a golfing range. We stayed 3 nights. The room was spacious, very clean, bathroom large, bed very comfortable. Even if we didn't have a balcony we could enjoy the view from a little terrace just outside the room. Staff very very friendly and helpful. Distance from the pier and the beach is minimal.For the price, we highly recommend it and we'll go back again!

We drove by and stopped, stayed due to cost.  In  the evening after driving all day we were tired...this looked like a decent motel we needed to park in back as room was on 1st floor in rear.  Room was OK looked clean. front of room had balcony and overlooked busy highway.  I left my cell phone there by mistake, room service found it and Nicky & Jenny (owners) sent it back to me via pre-paid fedex.  It was very honest of them since it was a newer blackberry...I would stay there again if I was in the area as accomodations good and price was right.

Summary Heading: Too expensive for a nights stay
Summary: We spent one night at the San Clemente Travelodge and I found it to be expensive for the accomodations that we got. The motel is located right off the freeway so opening your windows will mean opening up your room to the soothing sounds of the freeway cars.  Our window also opened up 4 feet from the the stucco walls of the next building and a partial view of the freeway.  We had to open the windows because although the room had a 'No Smoking" plaque on the door, when we walked in it immediately smelled of cigarette smoke. I guess the No Smoking sign is just there for the fire department because in our room were two ashtrays for our use.  Again for the amount that we paid for the night, I'm sure we could have gotten something nicer on El Camino Real (which is the main road in San

We spent the weekend at the Travelodge in San Clemente. They had nice rooms but the beds were so hard and Very uncomfortable. Neither my husband or I had a good night of sleep. (He’s a marine and has slept in some weird places and he did not sleep very well.)  We also paid extra for an “ocean view room” we saw barley the ocean. Mainly we saw the road, cars, and trees. Not even worth the extra money. How ever there was a microwave and a nice size fridge. The rooms we nice except for the bed.  I probably would not stay there again. I like comfortable beds.

Has nice big comfortable rooms, small refrigerator and microwave. Inside parking/ nice helpful staff. We like privacy, and we never got hassled. The only thing the picture doesn't show is that the motel is right on the freeway, and its noisy with the door open to the outside. Its about 6 blocks to the beach. We would stay here again. Its inexpensive, free rolls and coffee in morning, and is just nice for its price range, about 70 dollars a night, and that was in August, San Clemente is a great place to vacation in.
